video.title: Intro to HTML & CSS - Tutorial
video.description:
Learn the basics of HTML and CSS in this tutorial for beginners.

Check out more tutorials on our channel about HTML and CSS: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLWKjhJtqVAbnSe1qUNMG7AbPmjIG54u88

Tutorial created by Nano Productions. Check out their channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCudphoxex0cGrDmgPiz_H1Q

topLevelComment.author: Drumpf_4_All
topLevelComment.text: Live Server isn’t a real dev environment. Install vagrant with scotchbox or docker.

replies.author: Drumpf_4_All
replies.text: Traversy Media but, but, lamp stack. You taught us about lamp stacks. Ok, docker, I agree with you. Docker is advanced. Vagrant and scotchboxes make it super simple.

replies.author: What is Where
replies.text: @Nano Education Official There is one technical limitation if you use camelCase identifiers in your CSS - the |=selector specifier

replies.author: What is Where
replies.text: @Nano Education Official camelcase isn't for css, best way is to use BEM, canelcase u use in JS

replies.author: What is Where
replies.text: @Traversy Media anyway, why does he make id's in camelcase? I stopped watching right there. Even if it's for total beginners, he shouldn't do that.

replies.author: Traversy Media
replies.text: Lol, this is a beginner video. Vagrant and Docker? that would be absurd for html and css in general. Also, you have to think of the level of people watching
